resources.string: QuizApp
Welcome to Aviation Quiz App! Answer all the questions and see how much do you know about Aviation! Enjoy!
1.What are the four forces of flight?
2.Altitude in aviation is measured in?
hint: Meters, Feet or Kilometers
3.Following the Airbus A380, the next largest commercial aircraft is....

4.When this Boeing aircraft was originally launched, it wasn"'"t widely used and wasn"'"t a success at first. However, it is now one of the most used Boeing aircraft around today. What aircraft is it?
5.True or false: A stall is when the aircraft has lost too much airspeed and can no longer climb. Instead, it falls.
6.During the event of a stall, what should the pilot do to safely recover the aircraft?
7.Air Florida flight 90 crashed shortly after takeoff in a strong blizzard because....(Check all answers that are true)
8.The "Crash of the Century" which involved two Boeing 747"'"s was caused by....(Check all answers that are true)
9.True or false: A pilot of a Boeing 747–400 can see none of its engines from the cockpit.
10.Hydraulics of an aircraft are used to....
A. Crew, aircraft, luggage, passengers
B. Lift, thrust, drag, weight
A. The Boeing 747–400
B. The Boeing 777–300
A. Boeing 737
B. Boeing 747
A. True
B. False
A. Immediately put the aircraft in a climb to gain altitude
B. Increase thrust to full and put the aircraft in a dive to gain speed. The pilot may also use light flaps to gain lift.
A. The pilots failed to put on the Anti-Ice switch. This caused vital parts of the aircraft to stop working correctly
B. The Air Traffic Controller gave them wrong directions, ending up in a collision
C. Both of the planes engines failed
D. There was ice on the wings of the aircraft, this disrupted lift causing the plane to stall.
A. The pilot of one of the 747 is taking off without permission
B. The pilot of one of the 747 is not taxing off of the runway at the correct time
C. Heavy fog
D. The Air Traffic Controller gave one of the 747 permission to takeoff with the other 747 still on the runway
A. True
B. False
A. Power all important flight indicators such as airspeed, altitude, etc.
B. Move vital controls of the aircraft, such as rudder, elevator, etc.
Find out your score!
